gallery.gallery_title: How to Make the Most of a Creative Call

gallery_slide.gallery_image_caption: Ad agency Brooklyn Brothers hired Kareem Black to shoot ads for New Era. In describing his approach to the assignment, Black explained how he would elicit reactions from the subjects.

gallery_slide.gallery_image_credit: © UCSF BENIOFF CHILDREN’S HOSPITALS/PHOTO BY EVA KOLENKO
gallery_slide.gallery_image_caption: Because casting is important to much of the lifestyle work she shoots, Eva Kolenko will discuss her approach to choosing and directing subjects in the treatments she submits with her estimates for expenses.

gallery_slide.gallery_image_credit: © JOHN MUIR HEALTH/PHOTO BY ZACHARY SCOTT
gallery_slide.gallery_image_caption: Zachary Scott, who shoots conceptual work, sees the initial call with an agency as a conversation in which he tries to show creatives what kind of a collaborator he will be when the job begins.
